diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Primary cutaneous tuberculosis of the penis
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Chronic penile ulcer, infectious granulomatous diseases, foreign body reaction, vasculitides, inflammatory bowel disease, sarcoidosis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by the presence of a painless indurated ulcer on the penis, negative results from various cultures and stains, and ultimately a culture-positive result for Mycobacterium tuberculosis from the excision biopsy showing caseating granulomas. Molecular typing confirmed the identity and resistance profile of the organism.
